name: ln8
result:
{"name": "ln8", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 17) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 17 * q x > 34 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 17) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 17 * q x > 34 * x := by
  -- Extract the initial conditions from h0
  have h1 : p 0 = q 0 := h0.1
  have h2 : q 0 > 0 := h0.2
  -- Show that q'(y) > 0 for all y
  have h4 : ∀ y:ℝ, deriv q y > 0 := by
    intro y
    have h5 : deriv p y * deriv q y = 17 := hf' y
    have h6 : deriv p y > 0 := hP y
    nlinarith
  -- Use the AM-GM inequality to show that p'(y) + 17 * q'(y) ≥ 34
  have h7 : ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y + 17 * deriv q y ≥ 34 := by
    intro y
    have h8 : deriv p y * deriv q y = 17 := hf' y
    have h9 : deriv p y > 0 := hP y
    have h10 : deriv q y > 0 := h4 y
    nlinarith [sq_nonneg (deriv p y - 17 / deriv q y)]
  -- Integrate both sides over the interval [0, x]
  have h12 : p x + 17 * q x - (p 0 + 17 * q 0) ≥ 34 * x := by
    -- Use the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
    have h13 : ∀ y ∈ Icc 0 x, deriv p y + 17 * deriv q y ≥ 34 := by
      intro y hy
      apply h7 y
    -- Integrate over the interval [0, x]
    have h14 : ∫ y in 0..x, deriv p y + 17 * deriv q y ≥ ∫ y in 0..x, 34 := by
      apply intervalIntegral.integral_mono_on
      -- Show that the integrand is non-decreasing
      <;> simp_all [h13]
    -- Use the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
    have h15 : p x + 17 * q x - (p 0 + 17 * q 0) = ∫ y in 0..x, deriv p y + 17 * deriv q y := by
      -- Apply the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus for p and q
      simp [integral_add, integral_const_mul, hqDeriv.integrableOn_Icc, hpDeriv.integrableOn_Icc]
    rw [h15]
    linarith [h14]
  -- Use the initial conditions to conclude the proof
  have h16 : p 0 + 17 * q 0 = 18 * q 0 := by
    linarith [h1]
  have h17 : 18 * q 0 > 0 := by
    linarith [h2]
  linarith [h12, h17]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln73
result:
{"name": "ln73", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 200) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 40 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 200) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 40 * x := by
  have h1 := hP 0
  have h2 := hP 1
  have h3 := hqDeriv.differentiableAt
  have h4 := hpDeriv.differentiableAt
  have h5 := hf' 0
  have h6 := hf' 1
  simp_all [deriv_const, mul_comm]
  nlinarith [h0.2, hD.1, hD.2, h1, h2, h5, h6]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln138
result:
{"name": "ln138", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 2) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 4 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 2) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 4 * x := by
  -- Extract the given conditions for x = 0
  have h1 := h0.1
  have h2 := h0.2
  have h3 := hP 0
  have h4 := hf' 0
  -- Simplify the goal using the given conditions
  simp_all
  -- Use nlinarith to handle the inequality involving squares and non-negative terms
  nlinarith [sq_nonneg (deriv p 0 - 2), hP 0, hP 1, hqDeriv.differentiableAt, hpDeriv.differentiableAt]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln203
result:
{"name": "ln203", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 17) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 17 * q x > 34 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 17) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 17 * q x > 34 * x := by
  -- Verify the inequality at x = 0
  have h1 := h0.2
  have h2 := h0.1
  have h3 := hf' 0
  have h4 := hP 0
  have h5 := hP 1
  have h6 := hD.1
  have h7 := hD.2
  -- Use the Mean Value Theorem to analyze the behavior of p and q
  have h8 := hqDeriv.differentiableAt
  have h9 := hpDeriv.differentiableAt
  -- Use the given conditions to show the inequality holds for all x in [0, 1]
  nlinarith [sq_nonneg (deriv p 0 - 17), sq_nonneg (deriv p 1 - 17),
    sq_nonneg (deriv q 0 - 1), sq_nonneg (deriv q 1 - 1)]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln268
result:
{"name": "ln268", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 18) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 12 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 18) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 12 * x := by
  -- Define the interval [0, 1] for x
  have hD' : x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ) := hD
  -- Extract the lower and upper bounds of the interval
  rcases hD' with ⟨h1, h2⟩
  -- Use the mean value theorem to find a point where the derivative of the function f(x) = p(x) + 2q(x) - 12x is zero
  have h3 := hf' 0
  have h4 := hf' 1
  have h5 := hP 0
  have h6 := hP 1
  -- Simplify the expressions using the given conditions and properties of derivatives
  simp_all [deriv_const_mul, deriv_add, deriv_mul, deriv_id, mul_comm]
  -- Use non-linear arithmetic to conclude the proof
  nlinarith [sq_nonneg (deriv p 0 - 6), sq_nonneg (deriv p 1 - 6)]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln333
result:
{"name": "ln333", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 8) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 8 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 8) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 8 * x := by
  -- Extract the initial condition that p(0) = q(0) and q(0) > 0
  rcases h0 with ⟨h1, h2⟩
  -- Use the AM-GM inequality to bound the sum of derivatives
  have h3 : ∀ y : ℝ, deriv p y + deriv q y ≥ 8 := by
    intro y
    -- Apply the AM-GM inequality to the derivatives of p and q
    nlinarith [sq_nonneg (deriv p y - deriv q y), hP y, hf' y]
  -- Integrate the inequality over the interval [0, x]
  have h4 : p x + 2 * q x ≥ 8 * x + 3 * q 0 := by
    -- Use the fact that p and q are differentiable and their derivatives satisfy the given conditions
    have h5 : ∀ y ∈ Icc (0 : ℝ) x, deriv (fun y => p y + 2 * q y) y ≥ 8 := by
      intro y hy
      -- Compute the derivative of the sum p + 2q
      simp only [deriv_add, deriv_const_mul, hqDeriv.differentiableAt, hpDeriv.differentiableAt,
        hqDeriv.differentiableAt, hpDeriv.differentiableAt, deriv_add, deriv_const_mul]
      -- Use the AM-GM inequality to bound the derivative
      linarith [h3 y]
    -- Integrate the derivative inequality over the interval [0, x]
    exact
      calc
        p x + 2 * q x = p 0 + 2 * q 0 + ∫ y in 0..x, deriv (fun y => p y + 2 * q y) y := by
          -- Use the fundamental theorem of calculus to express the sum in terms of integrals
          simp [integral_add, integral_const_mul, hqDeriv.differentiableOn, hpDeriv.differentiableOn]
        _ ≥ p 0 + 2 * q 0 + ∫ y in 0..x, 8 := by
          -- Apply the integral inequality
          gcongr
          exact h5
        _ = 8 * x + p 0 + 2 * q 0 := by
          -- Simplify the integral of the constant function
          simp [integral_const]
        _ = 8 * x + 3 * q 0 := by
          -- Use the initial condition p(0) = q(0)
          linarith [h1]
  -- Conclude the proof using the initial condition q(0) > 0
  linarith [h2]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln398
result:
{"name": "ln398", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 98) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 28 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 98) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 2 * q x > 28 * x := by
  -- Establish that the derivative of p is positive, hence p is strictly increasing.
  have h1 := hP 0
  have h2 := hP 1
  -- Establish that the derivative of q is positive, hence q is strictly increasing.
  have h3 := hP 0
  have h4 := hP 1
  -- Use the AM-GM inequality to show that the sum of the derivatives of p and q is at least 28.
  have h5 := hf' 0
  have h6 := hf' 1
  -- Combine the inequalities and initial conditions to conclude the desired result.
  nlinarith [h0.1, h0.2, h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, hD.1, hD.2]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln463
result:
{"name": "ln463", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 75) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 3 * q x > 30 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 75) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 3 * q x > 30 * x := by
  -- Extract the initial conditions from h0
  have h1 := h0.1
  have h2 := h0.2
  -- Use the AM-GM inequality to establish a lower bound on the derivative of p + 3q
  have h3 := hP 0
  have h4 := hP 1
  have h5 := hqDeriv.differentiableAt
  have h6 := hpDeriv.differentiableAt
  -- Apply the AM-GM inequality to the derivatives of p and q
  have h7 : ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 75 := hf'
  -- Use the fact that the derivative of p + 3q is at least 30
  have h8 : ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) + 3 * (deriv q y) ≥ 30 := by
    intro y
    have h9 : 0 < deriv p y := hP y
    have h10 : 0 < deriv q y := by
      nlinarith [h7 y]
    nlinarith [sq_nonneg (deriv p y - 15), sq_nonneg (deriv q y - 15)]
  -- Integrate the derivative inequality over the interval [0, x]
  have h11 : p x + 3 * q x ≥ p 0 + 3 * q 0 + 30 * x := by
    have h12 : ∀ y ∈ Icc (0:ℝ) (1:ℝ), deriv (fun y => p y + 3 * q y) y ≥ 30 := by
      intro y hy
      simp only [deriv_add, deriv_const, deriv_mul, deriv_id'', mul_one, mul_zero, add_zero, zero_add] at h8 ⊢
      nlinarith [h8 y]
    exact
      le_of_sub_nonneg
        (by
          -- Use the mean value theorem to integrate the derivative inequality
          simpa using
            (norm_nonneg (p x + 3 * q x - (p 0 + 3 * q 0) - 30 * x))
  -- Conclude the proof using the initial conditions and the integrated inequality
  nlinarith [h11]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln528
result:
{"name": "ln528", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 75) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 3 * q x > 30 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 75) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 3 * q x > 30 * x := by
  -- Extract the initial condition p(0) = q(0) and q(0) > 0
  have h1 := h0.1
  have h2 := h0.2
  -- Use the fact that the product of the derivatives is 75 to derive a useful inequality
  have h3 := hf' 0
  have h4 := hf' x
  -- Simplify the expressions involving the derivatives
  simp at h3 h4
  -- Use the fact that the derivatives are positive to apply the AM-GM inequality
  have h5 := hP 0
  have h6 := hP x
  -- Use the AM-GM inequality to derive the desired inequality
  nlinarith [sq_nonneg (deriv p x - 15)]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}

name: ln593
result:
{"name": "ln593", "problem": "example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 75) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 3 * q x > 30 * x := by
", "proof": ["example (x: ℝ) (p q : ℝ → ℝ) (h0 : p 0 = q 0 ∧ q 0 > 0) (hf': ∀ y:ℝ, (deriv p y) * (deriv q y) = 75) (hqDeriv: Differentiable ℝ q) (hpDeriv: Differentiable ℝ p) (hP: ∀ y:ℝ, deriv p y > 0) (hD: x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ)): p x + 3 * q x > 30 * x := by
  -- Extract the initial conditions
  rcases h0 with ⟨h1, h2⟩
  -- Use the fact that p and q are differentiable and their derivatives satisfy p'(y) * q'(y) = 75
  have h3 := hf' 0
  have h4 := hf' 1
  -- Use the fact that p'(y) > 0 for all y
  have h5 := hP 0
  have h6 := hP 1
  -- Use the mean value theorem to show that p(x) + 3q(x) - 30x is non-decreasing
  have h7 : ∀ x ∈ Icc (0: ℝ) (1: ℝ), p x + 3 * q x - 30 * x > 0 := by
    intro x hx
    -- Use the AM-GM inequality to show that p'(x) + 3q'(x) ≥ 30
    have h8 : 0 ≤ x := by linarith [hx.1]
    have h9 : x ≤ 1 := by linarith [hx.2]
    -- Apply the AM-GM inequality
    nlinarith [sq_nonneg (deriv p x - 3 * deriv q x), hf' x, hP x, hP 0, hP 1]
  -- Conclude the proof using the non-decreasing property
  linarith [h7 x hD]"], "complete": true, "out": [], "informal_hints": ""}
